title: Taj Mahal
description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, the Taj Mahal is an ivory-white marble mausoleum on the south bank of the Yamuna river in the Indian city of Agra.

title: Indian Museum
description: Located in Kolkata, the Indian Museum is the largest and oldest museum in India, featuring rare collections of antiques, armor, ornaments, fossils, skeletons, mummies, and Mughal paintings.

title: Gateway of India
description: The Gateway of India is an arch-monument built in the early 20th century in the city of Mumbai, India. It was erected to commemorate the landing of King George V and Queen Mary at Apollo Bunder on their visit to India in 1911.

title: National Museum
description: The National Museum in New Delhi is one of the largest museums in India. It holds a variety of articles ranging from pre-historic era to modern works of art.

title: Mysore Palace
description: Mysore Palace is a historical palace and a royal residence at Mysore in the Indian state of Karnataka. It is the official residence of the Wadiyar dynasty and the seat of the Kingdom of Mysore.

title: Rajwada Palace
description: rajwada Palace is a historical palace and a royal residence at indore in the Indian state of Madhya pradesh. It is the official residence of the holkar dynasty and the seat of the Kingdom of indore.
